title: Poland Launches Demonstration of Suborbital Research Rocket
summary:
Poland has successfully launched a single-stage rocket demonstrator at the Central Air Force Training Ground in Ustka. The flight was part of a project to develop a three-stage solid-fuel rocket for research payloads. In 2020, the Polish government selected Wojskowe Zakłady Lotnicze No. 1 to lead a consortium developing a three-stage suborbital launch system. The […]
The post Poland Launches Demonstration of Suborbital Research Rocket appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Rocket Lab sees Mynaric deal as key for its constellation plans
summary:
Rocket Lab says its planned acquisition of a German optical communications supplier is key to its plans for both bidding on large constellations and eventually developing its own.
The post Rocket Lab sees Mynaric deal as key for its constellation plans appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: 28 Starlink satellites to launch on Falcon 9 booster making record breaking 28th flight
summary: The Starlink 6-83 mission will also mark SpaceX’s 100th Falcon 9 launch from Launch Complex 39A. Liftoff is targeted for 12:06 a.m. EDT (0406 UTC).

title: Trump administration to keep National Space Council
summary:
In a reversal, White House plans to retain the National Space Council, a move that industry officials say could serve as an advocate for space amid pressures to cut budgets.
The post Trump administration to keep National Space Council appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Rocket Lab to debut point-to-point cargo transportation capability on 2026 Air Force mission
summary: Rocket Lab is working towards the debut of its medium-lift reusable Neutron rocket in the second half of 2025. The company didn’t announce whether the rocket used on this mission would carry a payload onboard.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 6-91 mission includes the 900th Starlink V2 Mini satellite launched in 2025. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is targeted for Saturday, May 10 at 2:28 am EDT (0628 UTC).

title: 25 Years of NASA Student Launch
summary: Students from the University of Massachusetts Amherst team carry their high-powered rocket toward the launch pad at NASA’s 2025 Student Launch launch day competition in Toney, Alabama, on April 4, 2025. More than 980 middle school, high school, and college students from across the nation launched more than 40 high-powered amateur rockets just north of […]

title: What NASA Is Learning from the Biggest Geomagnetic Storm in 20 Years
summary: One year on, NASA scientists are still making huge discoveries about the largest geomagnetic storm to hit Earth in two decades, the Gannon storm. The findings are helping us better understand and prepare for the ways in which the Sun’s activity can affect us. One year ago today, representatives from NASA and about 30 other […]
